articles.title: General Staff of KPA Sends Open Ultimatum to S. Korean Group of Traitors
articles.content:
General Staff of KPA Sends Open Ultimatum to S. Korean Group of Traitors
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The General Staff of the Korean People's Army sent the following open ultimatum to the south Korean group of traitors on Monday:
					 The celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union are now taking place in the revolutionary capital of Pyongyang with splendor.
					
					 They are a great political festival of children unprecedented not only in the history of the Korean nation but in the long history of mankind.
					
					 As many as 20 000 delegates of school children have come to Pyongyang on invitation from all parts of the country, including remote villages and solitary islands.
					
					 It was the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the younger generation and the future that they showed paternal loving care and solicitude for them, calling them kings of the country. This outlook has been steadfastly carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 All the service members and people are immensely excited and pleased with this stirring reality.
					
					 The world is becoming envious of the DPRK, noting that such great event can take place in socialist Korea only.
					
					 But it is only the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea that is chilling the atmosphere of these auspicious events of the children.
					
					 From May 29 the group set in motion Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo, "A channel" of Dong-A Ilbo, KBS, CBS, MBC, SBS and other media to launch a campaign defaming the above-said celebrations. It went the lengths of resorting to a new campaign of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, availing itself of this opportunity.
					
					 The children of the kindergarten in magnificent and modern Changjon Street were so happy as to have a photo taken with      Kim Jong Un and sons and daughters of ordinary working people are participating in the above-said celebrations. However, the Lee group is letting loose a string of vituperations describing all these blessings as "charades intentionally orchestrated" by the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The auspicious political festival was opened amid joy and cheers of three million of schoolchildren, hailed by their fathers and mothers throughout the country. The group, however, is playing down it as "events for publicity stunt," "events to win popularity", "events to curry favor with them." It made no scruple of letting loose a spate of such invectives as deliberately hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, describing the great inheritance of the love for the younger generation and the future as "act of imitating gesture and copying after Hitler" and "the north's staging of a political show as that staged by the Nazis to train the Juvenile Corps.
					
					 And the Lee group went the lengths of describing the unblemished naive schoolchildren as "children on markets" more familiar with capitalist markets than socialist policies and "mere children knowing nothing about the world".
					
					 This is a new form of evil action hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. It is a thrice-cursed criminal act as it is a monstrous mud-slinging at the rosy future of our revolution.
					
					 There is no country in the world as the DPRK which projects children as kings of the country.
					
					 When babies are born, they are taken care of at palaces of babies and children are rapidly growing at children's palaces, bringing their talents into full bloom. They are leading such blessed lives under the immensely profound loving care of the great persons of Mt. Paektu, something rare to be found in any other parts of the world.
					
					 It was President Kim Il Sung who brought up all the children under his deep care with the noblest viewpoint on the younger generation and the future, despite snow and rain. It was leader Kim Jong Il who saw off the children leaving for their camps while starting his journey to the front along rugged roads in adversity.
					
					 It was Kim Jong Un who visited the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School on the New Year's Day and put forward its children as future pillars.
					
					 It was thanks to this profound care of the sun that the children were provided with ampler opportunities of learning and flags of the Children's Union fluttered more vigorously over their camps under the clean and blue sky of the country even under the difficult situation where its people had to fasten their belts in manifold adversity.
					
					 Children are the future of the country and a symbol of hope and victory.
					
					 The above-said vituperation let loose by the group of traitors is nothing but a shriek made by the group, utterly discomfited by the bright future of the supreme headquarters of the DPRK and rosy future of the younger generation.
					
					 From olden times, idiots are apt to see everything quite different from a reality.
					
					 It is quite natural that the group of traitors branded as fools, idiots and blockheads can hardly see the present world correctly.
					
					 If it is not true, how can the group describe the great inheritance of our nation as "imitation" and compare the children who would shoulder upon themselves the future of the nation with the juvenile organization of fascist Hitler?
					
					 As for Hitler, he was the fascist fanatic who drove guiltless humankind into pitfalls of disasters and death, special class war criminal who destroyed his country and nation and die-hard tyrant who had no love for its children.
					
					 The south Korean people had already branded the worst traitor Lee as a notorious "Hitler Lee" and burned the traitor in effigy in Nazi uniform, bearing the same moustache as Hitler's as he has been hell-bent on mercilessly suppressing the protestors at the point of bayonet and enforcing an unpopular rule.
					
					 It is said that one's wrong tongue-lashing is as harmful as a sword cutting off one's head.
					
					 Upon hearing the news that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and slandered its loved children, the officers and men of the three services of the KPA are expressing towering resentment and pledging themselves as one to resolutely settle accounts by force of arms with those who violated the moral law of the nation and defamed the great man whom the people follow and the world look up to.
					
					 Officers and men of the army corps, divisions and regiments on the front and strategic rocket forces in the depth of the country are loudly calling for the issue of order to mete out punishment, declaring that they have already targeted Chosun Ilbo at coordinates of 37 degrees 56 minutes 83 seconds North Latitude and 126 degrees 97 minutes 65 seconds East Longitude in the Central District, Seoul, Choongang Ilbo at coordinates of 37 degrees 33 minutes 45 seconds  North Latitude and 126 degrees 58 minutes 14 seconds East Longitude in the Central District, Seoul, the Dong-A Ilbo at coordinates of 37 degrees 57 minutes 10 seconds North Latitude and 126 degrees 97 minutes 81 seconds East Longitude in Jongro District, Seoul, KBS, CBS, MBC and SBS, the strongholds of the Lee group orchestrating the new vicious smear campaign.
					
					 In view of this grave situation the KPA General Staff sends the following ultimatum to the Lee group of traitors:
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are the army of the supreme commander and the people's army which is devotedly defending the supreme commander and protecting his idea and the people and children whom he values and loves so much.
					
					 It is the iron will of the army of the DPRK that the dens of heinous provocateurs hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and desecrating its idea, system and people should not be allowed to exist as they are.
					
					 We would like ask the Lee group if it wants leave all this to be struck by the DPRK or opt for apologizing and putting the situation under control, though belatedly.
					
					 It should take a final choice by itself.
					
					 Now it is impossible for the officers and men of the KPA three services to keep back their towering resentment any longer. In case dens of monstrous crimes are blown up one after another, the Lee group will be entirely held responsible for this.
					
					 If the Lee group recklessly challenges our army's eruption of resentment, it will retaliate against it with a merciless sacred war of its own style as it has already declared.
					
					 We are fully ready for everything.
					
					 Time is running out.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Swiss Ambassador
Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Blaise Godet, Swiss ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Government Gives Banquet for Cambodian Deputy PM and His Party
articles.content:
DPRK Government Gives Banquet for Cambodian Deputy PM and His Party
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government gave a banquet in honor of the deputy prime minister of the government of Cambodia who is also minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation and his party on Monday.
					 Present there on invitation were Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister of the government and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, and his party, Cambodian Ambassador Chhorn Hay and his embassy members here.
					
					 Present there were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung and other officials of the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Deputy Prime Minister of Cambodia Hor Nam Hong, minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, and his party visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Monday to pay homage to them. The guests laid bouquets before the statues and made a bow carrying with boundless reverence for the peerlessly great men.
					 A delegation of the All-China Women's Federation led by Zhen Yan, vice-chairwoman and member of the Secretariat of the federation, also laid a floral basket before the statues on the same day. 
					
					 They arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Johannes Pflug, member of Bundestag "Federal Parliament" of Germany from the Social-Democratic Party, and his party arrived here on Monday.
					 A delegation of the Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House led by General Director and Editor-in-Chief Ji Yu Gon came back home on Sunday after visiting China.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) visited the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They made a bow towards the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il hung on the facade of the palace in boundless reverence for them who left behind legends about the loving care for the younger generation to be conveyed in the long history, valuing and loving them as the future of the country, successors to the revolution and kings of the country.
					
					 They went round the plaza of the palace.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Visit Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union visited the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Monday. 
					 Looking up to the pictures of President Kim Il Sung and leader          Kim Jong Il with broad smiles on their faces, they paid homage to them, who seemed to bless the children with their rosy future. 
					
					 Choe Hyon A (13), a delegate from the Pangung Secondary School in Yomju County, North Phyongan Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "When I entered this plaza, it seemed to me that the Generalissimos were greeting us.
					
					 They will remain in our hearts as the eternal sun."
					
					 Han Tae Song (10), a delegate from the Jangjin Primary School in Jangjin County, South Hamgyong Province, said:
					
					 "I have always longed for visiting this place. Here, I feel like if I am being embraced by the Generalissimos."
					
					 Pak Chol Il (12), a delegate from the Toksa Secondary School at Sudong District in South Hamgyong Province, said:
					
					 "I brought ten thousand saplings of white broad bellflowers with me to plant them around the palace, at the request of my parents and home villagers. 
					
					 Thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un's loving care, I, a son of a coal miner, was appointed as a delegate to the celebrations of the KCU.
					
					 I will prepare myself to be an able pillar of Songun Korea." 
					
					 The delegates also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, at which they vowed to follow the spirit of resolutely defending the leader, the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu, which was displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) visited Mangyongdae, the cradle of the revolution.
					 They laid wreaths at the graves of President Kim Il Sung's grandfather Kim Po Hyon and grandmother Ri Po Ik, father Kim Hyong Jik and mother Kang Pan Sok and paid homage to them.
					
					 They were guided to the old home of Kim Il Sung there after making a round of the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum.
					
					 Going round the historical mementoes there, they learned about the great revolutionary careers and achievements of the family members of Mangyongdae. 
					
					 They looked round the warship rock, the wrestling site, the study site on Mangyong Hill, etc.
					
					 They also visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, and paid homage to her.
					
					 They also visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower. Going round the group sculptures, they determined to carry forward the spirit displayed by the heroes in unhesitatingly dedicating their lives and youth to the Workers' Party and leader during the last Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 Meanwhile, they visited Kim Il Sung University, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, etc. They enjoyed performances given by the artistes of the National Symphony Orchestra and acrobats and had a pleasant time in the Kaeson Youth Park.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Enjoy Circus
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Enjoy Circus
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Among the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union, those who came from North Hamgyong and Jagang provinces enjoyed themselves at the Pyongyang Circus Theatre on Sunday.
					 The performance raised its curtain with ice acrobatics "Youngsters on the Ice Rink". 
					
					 Physical acrobatics "Intelligent Pigeons", "Rope-Skipping" and animals' stunts "Bear and Monkey" were highly appreciated by the audience.
					
					 Physical acrobatic numbers, such as "Stunts on Elastic", "Balanced Ball Tricks" and "Plastic Acrobatics" drew a burst of applause from the delegates.
					
					 The comic acrobatic "Playing with Dolls" and juggleries "Arrays of Cards" and "Girls in Mirror" won enthusiastic cheers from the children.
					
					 The performance was crowned with aerial stunts "Flying Girls", which won gold prizes at international acrobatic festivals.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Take Meal at Okryu Restaurant
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Take Meals at Okryu Restaurant
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Among the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU), those from South Hamgyong Province Monday went to Okryu Restaurant on the banks of the River Taedong to take tray-noodle topped with minced meat, a specialty in Pyongyang.
					 Choe Hui Ran (27), a KCU instructor of Kwangmyong Primary School, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am fascinated by the architectural beauty of Okryu Restaurant. It is acme of beauty, delicacy and elegancy.
					
					 Chandeliers look like cluster of cotton when seen from one side and snowflakes from the other side. Floors studded with jewels are amazing. Soft chairs and beautiful flowers on the tables in the dining halls of peculiarly architectural design are all fascinating."
					
					 Pak Kwang Guk (13), a delegate from Songwon Secondary School, said:
					
					 "The tray-noodle topped with minced meat made me mouthwatering. It was really delicious. I had it in a blink."
					
					 Ri Un Song (12), a delegate from Phyongsu Secondary School, said:
					
					 "I, daughter of an ordinary worker, have been receiving hospitality as a guest of honor in Pyongyang nowadays. 
					
					 It was the first time for me to take such a delicious tray-noodle with minced meat on top in Okryu Restaurant. 
					
					 My country is the best in the world, as we have the dear respected Kim Jong Un, who projects children as the king of the country."
					
					 Choe Un Jong (11), a delegate from Tonghung Primary School, said:
					
					 "I was carried away by the view the moment I entered the dining hall. The hall was spacious and I could see the River Taedong through the window. Having taken a meal in this restaurant, I came to harden my pledge to study harder to live up to the loving care shown by the dear respected Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Birthday Spread to Woman Centenarian
articles.content:
Noble Outlook on Posterity Carried Forward in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union have been warmly welcomed by Pyongyang citizens everywhere they go.
					 Most of them are sons and daughters of workers, farmers and disabled soldiers and orphans as well.
					
					 The noble outlook on the posterity kept by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, who regarded children as the kings of the country, has been invariably carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 When visiting Mangyongdae Revolutionary School on the lunar New Year's Day, Kim Jong Un was afraid for students wearing no gloves in cold weather, warming their faces with his hands.
					
					 In its mess hall, he touched a bowl to see if Onban (cooked rice served in chicken soup) that a student was eating was hot.
					
					 On the campus in the twilight, he promised teachers of the school to send lawn to cover the playground and in an indoor stadium, he instructed them to flatten the floor to prevent students from being injured.
					
					 Touring the Kyongsang Kindergarten, he saw a performance given by its children and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 Going round the newly-built Changjon Primary School, he was satisfied with desks and chairs made to suit young pupils. 
					
					 While visiting the Children's Department Store, he told officials that he was hardening his determination to devotedly serve the children, the future of the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is, indeed, identical to Kim Il Sung, who took out 20 won as cost for making new clothes for the Children's Corps members in Maanshan during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, and to Kim Jong Il, who made uninterrupted inspection tours of military units to defend the happiness of children.

articles.title: Battle Ended in Victory with Stone Shower
articles.content:
Battle Ended in Victory with Stone Shower
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The battle in Mt. Kouyushui, which was conducted under the command of President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, was characterized by a shower of stones. 
					 On June 5, Juche 26 (1937), a day after victorious Pochonbo battle in the homeland, the main unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) took a brief rest at a village before mounting Mt. Kouyushui.
					
					 The President led the unit to the mountain, anticipating that the enemies would soon track the unit upon hearing the news of the attack on Pochonbo. 
					
					 The mountain was so rocky and steep that even an accidental roll of a stone may cause deadly rockslide.
					
					 He told soldiers to be careful not to roll a stone.
					
					 Making up his mind to turn rocks and stones to good account, he ordered the unit to get combat ready.
					
					 As the enemies approached, machine guns and rifles opened fire on his order.
					
					 The enemies desperately resisted with their bodies hidden behind rocks.
					
					 Suddenly a stone rolled down which turned into a shower of rocks in a matter of a moment. 
					
					 The enemies suffered wholesale deaths and the battle ended in victory on the KPRA side.

articles.title: Korea to Witness Partial Eclipse
articles.content:
Korea to Witness Partial Eclipse
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Korea will witness a partial eclipse on the evening of June 4.
					 The earth will stand in a beeline between the sun and the moon from 18:59 to 21:03, hiding about 37 percent of the full moon.
					
					 The moon rises at around 19:51, giving an opportunity to see the eclipse.
					
					 It will be eclipsed in the southeastern part.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Evading Settlement of Past: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Evading Settlement of Past: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Japan has not yet committed itself to making apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					 It is shown by Japan's persistent attempts to take down the monument to comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army in New Jersey State, United States.
					
					 Shortly ago, the Japanese consul general in New York and other Japanese diplomats asked the mayor of a city in New Jersey State to dismantle the monument and proposed an investment of a large amount of money in return for it.
					
					 The mayor declined to accept the proposal, bringing Japan into derision in the world eyes.
					
					 He said at a press conference that the monument is necessary to make war and violation of human rights not to repeat themselves.
					
					 The clan of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan, however, urged the chief cabinet secretary and the foreign minister to promptly take down the monument. 
					
					 What is ridiculous is that the foreign minister said "he will try to figure out the best way as there are several alternatives for attaining the purpose".
					
					 It is a shameless act indeed.
					
					 The ulterior aim behind the Japanese reactionaries' persistent approach to dismantling the monument is to hide the most hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past and shirk their responsibility for settling the past. 
					
					 The Japanese administrators seem to think they can cover up the past crimes forever by removing the monument.
					
					 It is highly ridiculous and foolish for them to think that way.
					
					 In the last century, Japan committed big crimes against human beings. 
					
					 Especially the Japanese imperialists forced lots of women in the regions under their occupation to sexual slavery for the aggressor troops, the most hideous crime against humanity in the world history of wars.
					
					 The Samurais of Japan are unheard-of barbarians and human scum as they committed such a hideous crime beyond human imagination based on their abnormal military logic.
					
					 It is quite natural for the international community to demand the Japanese government admit the past crimes including the sexual slavery and make sincere apology and compensation for them.
					
					 But what is Japan doing?
					
					 It has gone to extraordinary length to prevaricate in the matter of its past crimes by deleting the expression "comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army" from the textbooks for the senior high schools and deceiving the people with crafty farce of making "reparation" with public-raised fund. 
					
					 This is a challenge to justice and conscience and another crime against the victims.
					
					 It is prerequisite for settling the past to make sincere apology and reparation.
					
					 It is impossible for Japan to gain something by showing off its money bag without sincere repentance of the past. It will only give birth to second, third monument to comfort women.
					
					 It will be beneficial for Japan, too, to settle its past.

articles.title: Japan's Moves for Reinvasion of Korea Slammed
articles.content:
Japan's Moves for Reinvasion of Korea Slammed
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Japan is working hard to take part in the joint military drills with the U.S. and Australia slated in the Pacific waters and the U.S.-led joint air force drill due in Alaska.
					 Minju Joson Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Japan seeks to turn it into a military power and realize its ambition for overseas expansion at any cost backed by the U.S., its master. Japan's attempt to participate in the military drills proves that the above-said moves are being put into practice in a reckless phase.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have repeatedly had military confabs while calling for the strengthened military alliance with the U.S. They let the Self-Defense Forces participate in almost all the military drills in the Asia-Pacific region. Japan does not hesitate to make military expenditure running at astronomical figures despite the unprecedentedly difficult economic situation.
					
					 Japan's execution of a role as a war servant for the U.S. is meant to open the path of overseas aggression backed by the U.S.
					
					 Japan's moves to become a military power and launch reinvasion have gone beyond the danger line. Japan's Ground "Self-defence Force" has turned into powerful force with more than 10 division-size troops capable of fighting an actual war while the Maritime and Air "Self-Defense Forces" have turned into regular forces. This made Japan rank itself among the world's military powers.
					
					 What is left to be done by it now is to put into practice its ambition for overseas aggression.
					
					 Japan should clearly know that its option of reinvasion will lead to its total collapse.
					
					 Japan's ambition for overseas aggression is a pipe-dream.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Il Sung's Ideological and Theoretical Exploits
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Il Sung's Ideological and Theoretical Exploits
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was a peerlessly great man who led global independence to victory with his outstanding ideas and theories, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 The President founded the immortal Juche idea, making lucid and perfect clarification of urgent issues arising in the national liberation movements in colonies and the building of a new society in the newly independent countries, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The Juche idea is a new guiding idea of revolution in the era of independence.
					
					 The President termed the anti-imperialist and anti-colonial movement of Asian, African and Latin-American people a sacred struggle for liberating hundreds of millions of oppressed and maltreated people, a struggle for cutting off the lifeline of imperialism and a revolutionary struggle of the international working class for socialism. 
					
					 The President also laid down a wise policy that if countries build self-supporting national economy and boost south-south cooperation, they can weather difficulties and hardships in building a new society and achieve progress and prosperity by their own efforts.
					
					 Independence, peace and friendship are the basic idea and principle for activities to be adhered to in the movement for building a new independent world. This is the main idea enunciated by the President for global independence.
					
					 The President clarified principled requirements, tasks and strategy and tactics for building an independent world, including the idea that what is important for global independence is to expand and develop the Non-aligned Movement and strengthen the global movement for defending peace. 
					
					 The President scientifically proved the justice and truth of the cause of socialism and the inevitability of its final victory and made perfect clarification of principles and theoretical and practical issues arising in socialist construction.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Assails S. Korea's Planned Purchase of Military Hardware from U.S.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Assails S. Korea's Planned Purchase of Military Hardware from U.S.
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is reportedly envisaging the import of huge amount of military hardware worth of more than ten billion U.S. dollars from the U.S. under the pretext of coping with "threat from the north." A typical example is the purchase of multi-purpose helicopter MH-60R Sea Hawk and Harpoon missile now on the way by the south Korean puppet forces at the cost of more than a billion of U.S. dollars.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 South Korea's planned purchase of military hardware is really a reckless one as it will further escalate the military confrontation and tension between the north and the south and increase the danger of a war in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 More dangerous is that most of the military hardware to be purchased by the puppet war maniacs is up-to-date fighters, drones, missiles and other means for pre-emptive strikes, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 What the group of Lee Myung Bak seeks in its reckless moves of importing combat equipment from the U.S. by spending huge amount of money is to win favor and support from its U.S. master in return for bulging its money purse and thus realize its ambition for stay in power and ignition of a war against the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 Never to be tolerated are such acts of spending the money collected from the south Korean people as taxes for plunging the nation and the territory into a war and fattening up the U.S. master, not for addressing people's destitution.
					
					 The pro-U.S. conservative forces should not be allowed to return to power not only for the peace on this land but to rid the south Koreans of present misery and pain.
					
					 The huge arms buildup being stepped up by the Lee group of traitors while citing the DPRK is a foolish and self-suicidal act of war maniacs bereft of reason.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign Assailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign Assailed
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors has persistently kicked up "human rights" campaign against the DPRK in south Korea and abroad by putting to use the worst conservative elements and despicable human scum, while talking about woeful "human rights situation" and "wind of change".
					 With such disgusting and mean rhetoric the Lee group tries to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK, tighten international siege to it and, at the same time, erode the people's trust in socialist system in a bid to break the single-minded unity of its army and people, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined article. 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The Lee group is ridiculed by the world people for its worst human rights abuses. It is absurd for it to talk about "human rights" of someone. 
					
					 During its term the group pursued unpopular rule unprecedented in history and anti-reunification policy of confrontation, thereby plunging south Korea into the extreme political chaos and the north-south relations into deadlock. Now it is dearly paying for such doings. 
					
					 The conservative group's despicable and mean "human rights" campaign will more clearly reveal its nature of escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen and committing all sorts of despicable acts. 
					
					 Their anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign is a sinister move to quench the desire for reunification through alliance with the north mounting in south Korea. 
					
					 What remains to be done now is to mete out thorough and merciless punishment to the Lee group of traitors now that it is openly exposing its long-running attempt for "unification of systems" while persistently conducting anti-DPRK campaign.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Accused of Her Involvement in Case of Pusan Savings Bank
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Accused of Her Involvement in Case of Pusan Savings Bank
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Wrangle between the ruling and opposition parties has recently become a social concern in south Korea over the issue of Park Geun Hye's involvement in the case of Pusan Savings Bank.
					 At a time when there is growing furor over involvement of traitor Lee Myung Bak and the "Saenuri Party" (SP) in the above-said case, Pak Ji Won, chairman of the Emergency Measure Committee of the Democratic United Party (DUP), raised recently the suspicion that Park Geun Hye, chief of the "Saenuri Party", met several times with Pak Thae Gyu, backstage negotiator over the case. 
					
					 On her part, Pak Geun Hye blamed Pak Ji Won, asserting she knows nothing about him.
					
					 The DUP said the false testimony made by the Park's side is nothing but a stopgap measure to tide over her ruling crisis, complaining her two confidants to the Seoul District Prosecutor's Office.
					
					 As already known, the case is not a mere financial scandal of a private bank but a hideous scandal committed by those in power directly linked with the Lee Myung Bak group. 
					
					 According to the puppet prosecution's investigation, the group of Pusan Savings Bank accumulated a lot of illicit funds by making various speculations including the purchase of real estates with money deposited on the bank and distributed huge bribes among politicians, bureaucrats and judicial figures in a bid to hush up its scams. 
					
					 When the disclosure of its scandal forced the group to suspend its business, it let high-ranking officials, its old acquaintances, know about it in advance to take money back from the bank while making the money of majority of ordinary people in the area of Pusan seized, triggering off protest among inhabitants in the area.
					
					 At that time bankers, finance supervising institutions, lawmakers in Pusan area, "government" officials and even heavyweights of Chongwadae were reported to have been involved in the case, putting at least 40 high-ranking officials under investigation.
					
					 It was already disclosed that Lee Myung Bak's cousin-in-law was one of the chief culprits who spawned the scandal.
					
					 This guy was reported to have expropriated hundreds of millions of won, while receiving requests from the bank to exercise influence on the relevant organ so that it might get rid of its crisis and put its business to normal.
					
					 The suspected involvement in such hideous case is extended to the Park's side.
					
					 There is no smoke without fire.
					
					 Park Geun Hye and her clan experienced the charm of power is precisely that of money under the Lee Myung Bak's regime.
					
					 It was none other than Park Geun Hye and her group that wallowed in luxury, engrossed in all sorts of scandals under the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 Given the fact that Lee and Park are in the state of marriage for political reasons, Park's involvement in the case may be brought to light any time.

articles.title: Works of Kim Jong Un Praised by Choson Sinbo
articles.content:
Works of Kim Jong Un Praised by Choson Sinbo
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Choson Sinbo, organ of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), editorially called for waging a dynamic campaign for the study of the important works of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					 The editorial said his works "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" and "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" serve as revolutionary programs as they clearly indicate the way for inheriting and accomplishing the cause of the Juche revolution started in Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 The ideas and theories enunciated in the works including the issue of developing the Workers' Party of Korea into an eternal party of the leader under the banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, strengthening the single-minded unity of the party and revolutionary ranks and thoroughly embodying the Songun line serve as precious guidelines for achieving the prosperity in the new century of Songun Korea, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 All the officials of Chongryon should more deeply grasp the greatness of Kim Jong Un who remains faithful to the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The editorial called upon Chongryon officials to study harder the works, with main emphasis on thoroughly implementing the tasks facing their respective fields and units, with the ideas and theories expounded in the works as absolute standards and rulers and make efforts to ensure that their vitality is clearly manifested in the patriotic movement of Chongryon.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Indonesian
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Indonesian
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian figure praised President Kim Il Sung as a great man of the century.
					 Rachmawati Soekarnoputri, chairwoman of the Founding Committee of Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia, when interviewed by TVONE on May 28, said as follows over the release of a book to mark the centenary of the President's birth:
					
					 I wrote the book "President Soekarno and President Kim Il Sung" to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The book deals in detail with the friendly relations between Kim Il Sung and Soekarno.
					
					 They had common viewpoints in many aspects and were strong in anti-imperialist stand.
					
					 They visited each other's countries in 1964 and 1965.
					
					 Kim Il Sung greatly contributed to the national liberation struggle in colonial countries.
					
					 He was an elder statesman of the world who actively struggled for unity among the progressive forces of the world, among the newly emerging countries in particular.
					
					 She said that she was pleased with her writing of the book about Kim Il Sung, a great man of the century, adding that she would publish the book in several other national languages in the future.
					
					 The TVONE said about the contents of the interview, showing the photos of Kim Il Sung making an address in the tribune of honor of the military parade for celebrating the war victory, and the two presidents looking round the Bogor Botanical Garden in Indonesia.

articles.title: Nigerian Figures Praise DPRK
articles.content:
Nigerian Figures Praise DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Members of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who participated in the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung expressed their impressions of the visit to the DPRK on May 24.
					 The secretary of the Association said that his delegation participated in the celebrations and visited Mangyongdae, the secret camp on Mt. Paektu and various other places.
					
					 He added that the statues of the peerlessly great men were successfully built on Mansu Hill and the members of the delegation had the supreme honor of seeing the dear respected Kim Jong Un and hearing his speech at the military parade commemorating the 100th Day of the Sun.
					
					 The celebrations and tour of various places helped them witness the sense of organization, unity and militant spirit of the Korean people and invincible might of the heroic Korean People's Army which grew up to be a matchless army, he stressed.
					
					 Ibrahim Mantu, former deputy president of Senate of the National Assembly who doubles as chairman of the Association, said that during his stay he saw the boundless reverence of the Korean people for Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their indomitable will to carry forward and accomplish the cause of preceding leaders to the end united close around supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as secretary general of the Association, noted that he witnessed the reality of the DPRK maintaining an independent stand and dynamically accelerating the building of a thriving nation despite the imperialists' sanctions and pressure, being guided by the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 The Juche idea and the Songun idea serve as powerful ideological and moral wealth that guarantees the popular masses a genuine life as independent human beings, he stressed.

articles.title: DPRK Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Held in Peru
articles.content:
DPRK Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Held in Peru
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- A DPRK book, photo and handicraft exhibition took place in Peru on May 17 and 18 on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Displayed at the venue were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos of their undying revolutionary feats, books and photos of Songun Korea and handiworks associated with the creative talents of the Korean people.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony of the exhibition were officials of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru, the Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting’s Union, the San Isidro Municipal Office in Lima, the Pyongyang Cultural Center in Peru and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people, diplomatic envoys in Peru and masses.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Peru and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: U.S. Newspaper's False Information on Iran Rejected
articles.content:
U.S. Newspaper's False Information on Iran Rejected
 Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- The Iranian permanent representative at the UN on May 29 bitterly rejected the Washington Post over its assertion of Iran's involvement in terrorism.
					 The paper on May 28 said that people related to Iran had hatched plots to kill foreign diplomats in several countries over the last year.
					
					 In this regard, he disclosed that the groundless assertion made by the paper was a fabrication invented by the U.S. administration pursuant to its policy to put illegal pressure upon Iran.
					
					 Noting that Iran has been a major victim to terrorism and thousands of Iranian citizens including scientists have been targets of the organized terrorism, he stressed that his country has consistently been opposed to any form of terrorist acts.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de fiesta a Yun Son Nyo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de fiesta a Yun Son Nyo
Pyongyang, 4 de junio (ACNC) -- Cumplio cien anos Yun Son Nyo que vive en la unidad de vecinos no. 5 del barrio Phohang del municipio Sin-am de la ciudad de Chongjin de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un le envio los alimentos de fiesta en ocasion de su centenario.
					
					La abuela esta agradecida del Maximo Dirigente quien presta atencion al cumpleanos de una anciana comun aunque esta muy ocupado por atender multiples asuntos estatales.
					
					Ella nacio en una familia campesina muy pobre de la comuna Sapho del distrito Hwadae de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte y vivio sufriendo las desgracias impuestas por los colonialistas japoneses.   Comenzo a llevar una vida digna y feliz desde cuando el Presidente Kim Il Sung libero la patria del coloniaje japones.
					
					Ella mantiene buena salud y atiende las faenas del hogar.
					
					Vive con optimismo instruyendo a los descendientes trabajar mucho por la patria grata.

articles.title: Extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 4 de junio (ACNC) -- Hor Nam Hong, vicepremier del gobierno y ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y cooperacion internacional del Reino de Cambodia y su comitiva depositaron el dia 4 ramos de flores ante las estatuas de bronce del Presidente           Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il erguidas en la colina Mansu y les rindieron homenaje.
					El mismo dia, la delegacion de la Federacion Nacional de Mujeres de China encabezada por Zhen Yan, vicepresidenta y secretaria del secretariado, coloco ante las estatuas un cesto de flores.
					
					Los extranjeros llegaron este dia a esta capital.

articles.title: Delegados infantiles visitan Jardin Botanico y Parque Zoologico
articles.content:
Delegados infantiles visitan Jardin Botanico y Parque Zoologico
Pyongyang, 4 de junio (ACNC) -- Los delegados de la organizacion de ninos de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur a los actos por el 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Corea (ONC), visitaron el Jardin Botanico Nacional y el Parque Zoologico Nacional, enclavados al pie del pintoresco monte Taesong.
					Al cabo de recorrer varios puntos del Jardin Botanico Nacional, entre otros, el Invernadero de Kimjongilias, el Museo de Plantas y el invernadero de plantas-regalos, los pioneros dijeron que "parecen que se encuentren aqui todas las plantas de nuestro pais y otros del mundo" y "seran magnificos floricultores para poner una alfombra de flores en el camino por donde pase por el Maximo Dirigente   Kim Jong Un.
					
					Y se decidieron a hacer bien estudio y vida organizativa para responder a la gran benevolencia del Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Al llegar al Parque Zoologico Nacional los empleados les felicitaron calurosamente dando collares y ramitas de flores.
					
					Escuchando las explicaciones de las guias, recorrieron el acuario, la piscina de foca, el pabellon de animales-regalos, la jaula de fieras y otros lugares.
					
					Entrevistada con la ACNC, Hong Pyol Hui (14 anos de edad) de la Escuela Secundaria de Ryongyon del distrito del mismo nombre dijo como sigue:
					
					Senti muy encantado mirando los talentos de focas, monos, perros de diversion y otros animales.
					
					Lo mas interesante fue que el elefante nos saludaba.
					
					Si regreso a mi casa, dire a mis padres y vecinos lo que vi hoy.
					
					Los pioneros recorrieron varios puntos del Parque en coche y carro de baterias, charlando y sonriendo.
					
					Rim Kwang Hak (35 anos de edad), secretario de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung en el distrito de Unchon, dijo a la ACNC que al guardar en lo profundo de corazon el amor del Maximo Dirigente quien dispensa para las generaciones venideras, dedicara toda su inteligencia y pasion a formar a los pioneros como protagonistas del futuro.

articles.title: ACNC comenta la actitud evasiva de Japon en la liquidacion del pasado
articles.content:
ACNC comenta la actitud evasiva de Japon en la liquidacion del pasado
Pyongyang, 4 de junio (ACNC) -- Japon continua con su absurda ambicion de eludir la liquidacion de sus crimenes del pasado manchados de sangre.
					Por ejemplo, se mueve obstinadamente para eliminar el monumento en memoria de las ex consoladoras sexuales del viejo ejercito japones, levantado en New Jersey, Estados Unidos.
					
					Hace unos dias, el consul general y otros diplomaticos japoneses, acreditados en Nueva York, suplicaron al alcalde de una ciudad de New Jersey el desalojamiento de ese monumento a cambio de las ofertas de fabulosas inversiones.
					
					Pero, pasaron tremenda pena a la vista del mundo cuando el alcalde rechazo la propuesta japonesa en una conferencia de prensa diciendo que ese monumento es imprescindible para evitar la repeticion de guerras y violaciones de derechos humanos.
					
					Sin embargo, los obstinados compinches del Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon urgieron lo mismo al director del secretariado y al ministro del Exterior. Sumandose a la opinion de ellos, el canciller japones dijo que "pensaria bien en las maneras de conseguir ese objetivo".
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses insisten en remover el monumento en cuestion para encubrir sus tremendos crimenes cometidos en el siglo pasado y evadir cueste lo que cueste su liquidacion.
					
					Pero, son demasiado grandes y graves para ser ocultados esos crimenes de lesa humanidad.
					
					Particularmente, la conversion de incontables mujeres de las zonas ocupadas durante la segunda guerra mundial en esclavas sexuales de las tropas agresoras japonesas es una barbarie sin precedentes en la historia mundial de guerras.
					
					Es natural que la sociedad internacional este exigiendo al gobierno japones reconocer francamente su sucio expediente criminal del pasado, incluyendo el caso de ex consoladoras sexuales, pedir disculpas sinceramente e indemnizarlo. No obstante, Japon se porta al contrario.
					
					Elimino la palabra ex consoladoras sexuales del ejercito japones en los manuales de historia que usan los alumnos de la secundaria e intenta eludir la liquidacion de sus crimenes mediante la farsa de "indemnizacion" por conducto de un fondo civil.
					
					Esto es un desafio a la justicia y la conciencia y doble crimen contra las victimas.
					
					La sincera disculpa y la indemnizacion son requisitos de la liquidacion del pasado.
					
					Si los reaccionarios japoneses siguen actuando como ahora, apareceran el segundo y el tercer monumentos en memoria de las ex consoladoras.
					
					La liquidacion del pasado es necesaria para ellos mismos.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena intento de reagresion de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena intento de reagresion de Japon
Pyongyang, 4 de junio (ACNC) -- Recientemente, Japon trata de participar en los ejercicios conjuntos militares EE.UU.-Australia que se desarrollan en las aguas de Asia-Pacifico, y en los ejercicios conjuntos de las fuerzas aereas que se realizan en Alaska bajo el auspicio de EE.UU. 
					Esto demuestra que se hace realidad en la etapa imprudente las maniobras de Japon tendentes a realizar sin falta la conversion de su pais en una potencia militar y la ambicion de expansion al extranjero bajo el amparo de su amo norteamericano.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 4 y prosigue:
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses que repiten la conspiracion miliar so pretexto de fortalecimiento de la alianza militar con EE.UU., hacen participar a las "fuerzas de autodefensa" en casi todos los ejercicios militares que EE.UU. libra en la zona de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Aunque se halla en una grave situacion economica sin precedente Japon invierte suma cantidad astronomica de gastos militares.
					
					Japon cumple el papel de sirviente de guerra de EE.UU. con el fin de abrir el camino de agresion al extranjero llevando a cuestas el imperio.
					
					Ya pasaron el limite peligroso las maniobras de Japon encaminadas a convertir su pais en una potencia militar y realizar la nueva agresion.
					
					Las "fuerzas terrestres de autodefensa" tienen los efectivos de mas de 10 divisiones en su envergadura y las "fuerzas navales y aereas de autodefensa" se han convertido en el ejercito regular.
					
					Como resultado, Japon ha ocupado el orden de las potencias militares del mundo.
					
					Solo le queda llevar a la practica la ambicion de agresion al ultramar.
					
					Pero, Japon debe darse clara cuenta de que nunca puede realizarlo. Si toma el camino de reagresion al ultramar sera arruinado por completo.
